{{ja-kanjitab|つき|み|yomi=k}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=つきみ|月|tr1=tsuki|t1=moon|見|tr2=mi|t2=viewing, seeing|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{ja-l|見る}} ''miru'' “to see, to watch”}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|つきみ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|つきみ}}

# [[moon]] [[viewing]], generally of the [[full moon]]
# a [[celebration]] of the [[harvest moon]] in autumn
# a type of [[cuisine]], with one [[egg]] in the center of the dish, either [[raw]] or [[sunny-side up]], with the [[yolk]] representing the full moon

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|viewing the moon}} {{ja-r|観月|かんげつ}}

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|linkto=月見饂飩|月見 饂飩|つきみ うどん}}: ''tsukimi''-style [[udon]] noodles
* {{ja-r|linkto=月見藁麦|月見 藁麦|つきみ そば}}: ''tsukimi''-style [[soba]] noodles
* {{ja-r|linkto=月見団子|月見 団子|つきみ だんご}}: ''tsukimi''-style [[dango]] dumplings
